intro: Trigonia rytidocarpa, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often forming compact rosettes of broad, waxy leaves. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and are pollinated by insects. Trigonia rytidocarpa is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
